channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Think You’re Too Old to Start a Business? Science Says People in their 40s, 50s, and Even 60s Have a Distinct Advantage
item.description: Especially if your goal is to start a remarkably successful company.

item.title: Is AI Is Killing Entry-Level Hiring? Not at Shopify
item.description: Conventional wisdom says automation is wiping out low-level positions. Not on CEO Tobi Lütke’s watch.

item.title: Satya Nadella wants the internet to keep an open mind about AI. The internet isn’t having it
item.description: A new insult for artificial intelligence just dropped thanks to Microsoft’s CEO. If you use Microsoft products, it’s near impossible to avoid AI now. ...

item.title: A Booming Economy Doesn’t Help the Job Market
item.description: More productivity could actually be a negative for labor market growth.

item.title: Deepfakes drastically improved in 2025. They’re about to get even harder to detect
item.description: Over the course of 2025, deepfakes improved dramatically. AI -generated faces, voices, and full-body performances that mimic real people increased in ...

item.title: Perspective Matters: What a 3D Street Artist Can Teach Us About Creativity, Technology, and Constraints
item.description: How a top artist solves the problem of ideas.

item.title: Singapore-based startup founder Anand Roy thinks generative AI can help fix a broken music sector
item.description: Roy started Wubble in 2024; now his generated tunes are used by global giants and even the Taipei Metro, to soothe harried commuters.

item.title: Verizon chief talent officer says Gen Z grads shouldn’t snub retail or hospitality jobs in the current economy: ‘Just start somewhere’
item.description: As AI steals entry-level office jobs, Verizon’s chief talent officer says Gen Z grads should be 'open to a different path.' Namely, retail and hospita...

item.title: CES: Where is consumer tech headed? Check out these four prototypes
item.description: CES is a show that’s all about the future. Usually, that future is within the next year or two. Companies show off products to kick off marketing camp...

item.title: Every brand needs to be ready for its Maduro Nike tracksuit moment
item.description: Brands love to insert themselves into cultural conversations or piggyback on buzzy current events, a strategy sometimes called newsjacking . But it ca...

item.title: Neuroscience Says This is What Happens to Kids Whose Parents Get Strict About Screen Time
item.description: Accelerated maturation in brain networks? What’s not to like? Oh.

item.title: Why most strategic plans fail just as often as New Year’s resolutions
item.description: Strategic planning is a big business. Companies spend millions of dollars working with consulting firms to chart a path forward. Not only does a lot o...

item.title: Tennessee theater professor reinstated, with $500,000 settlement, after losing his job over a Charlie Kirk-related social media post
item.description: Sen. Marsha Blackburn had circulated a screenshot indicating the professor had posted a headline about Charlie Kirk's stance on the 2nd Amendment.

item.title: From George Floyd to Trump calling Somali immigrants ‘garbage’ to a fatal ICE shooting, Minnesota’s in the crosshairs
item.description: In June, a Democratic state lawmaker and her husband were assassinated by a Trump supporter, although conservatives blame Tim Walz.

item.title: Mass shootings on campus give rise to a new kind of life-saving service journalism: an anonymous message board called Sidechat
item.description: Described by Harvard Magazine as “the College’s stream of collective consciousness,” Sidechat allows anyone with a verified university email to post.
